node.title: Healy blasts Australia to World Cup win
node.description: Australia have won the ICC Women's Cricket World Cup, defeating England by 71 runs in Christchurch.

node.title: New Zealand cyclists start strong at Oceania Champs
node.description: New Zealand's elite track riders made a record-setting start to the Oceania Championships in Brisbane.

node.title: North Korea warns South of destructive action after military remarks
node.description: North Korea has warned it will destroy major targets in Seoul if the South takes any "dangerous military action" such as a preemptive strike.

node.title: Covid-19 update: 8810 new cases, 18 deaths, 690 in hospital
node.description: New community case numbers in New Zealand have dropped below the 10,000 mark for the first time in more than a month, with 8810 new community cases reported today, along with 18 new deaths.

node.title: Covid-19 creates backlog of 50,000 smear tests
node.description: A warning has been issued over the backlog in routine cervical smear tests, one of a number of routine GP services delayed due to Covid-19.

node.title: Display of Taiwanese flag on menu leaves cafe with sour taste
node.description: A cafe owner says its star rating declined after a customer was critical of the cafe's use of a Taiwanese flag.

node.title: Pakistan Prime Minister suggests he might not accept vote to oust him
node.description: Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan has suggested he might not accept a vote to oust him, a move he alleged was being orchestrated by the US.

node.title: Building supply company clamps down on GIB hoarding
node.description: A major building supply company in Wellington has resorted to spot checks of building sites to ensure builders are not hoarding plasterboard.

node.title: Fog-busting technology receives government backing
node.description: A start-up company offering a method to clear fog at airports has received government backing.

node.title: UNC defeats Duke to secure spot in NCAA championship game
node.description: UNC will take on the Kansas Jayhawks on Monday night in New Orleans.

node.title: New Zealand overcome slow start to dominate the Dutch
node.description: New Zealand have survived an early scare to defeat the Netherlands by 118 runs at Seddon Park in Hamilton.

node.title: Tech executive's brutal kidnapping caught on surveillance video
node.description: After neighborhood security cameras show Tushar Atre fighting for his life during a vicious attack near his Santa Cruz, California, home, he is later found shot to death at his cannabis farm 14 miles away.

node.title: Firefighters battle blaze in mānuka bush south of Invercargill
node.description: Firefighters are battling a major vegetation fire at Awarua, south of Invercargill.

node.title: Two people found dead at Christchurch house
node.description: A police investigation is underway after two people were found dead at a property in the Christchurch suburb of Riccarton last night.

node.title: Customers expected to bear cost of $1.3 billion scheme to vet engineers
node.description: A new tougher regime for policing engineers will see the costs passed on to customers.

node.title: Man held in Guantanamo Bay for nearly 20 years sent home to Algeria
node.description: Sufyian Barhoumi was captured in Pakistan and taken to the U.S. base at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, in 2002.

node.title: Backlog of estimated 50,000 smear tests due to Covid-19 'concerning'
node.description: A warning has been issued over the backlog in routine cervical smear tests, one of a number of routine GP services delayed due to Covid-19.

node.title: How Ukrainian children are documenting the war they are witnessing
node.description: A 6-year-old who fled her home in Kyiv has drawings of her pet cat, as well as a Russian ship.

node.title: Power prices to jump up to $1000 a year for some users - Powerswitch
node.description: Consumer NZ's Powerswitch has been crunching the numbers and says it has found some power users will be facing price hikes of up to $1000 a year.

node.title: $10m wildlife centre to be haven for native birds
node.description: An environmental group is hoping visitors will flock to a multimillion dollar wildlife centre planned for Inglewood.

node.title: Bob Baffert banned from Santa Anita amid 90-day suspension
node.description: Legendary horse trainer Bob Baffert has been suspended by the California Horse Racing Board effective Monday, as the state regulatory board honors Baffert's 90-day suspension by the Kentucky Racing Commission over the positive medication test by last year's disqualified Kentucky Derby winner Medina Spirit.

node.title: MS-13 gang leader sentenced to life in prison
node.description: Miguel Angel Corea Diaz last year was convicted of multiple charges, including murder and conspiracy to commit murder.

node.title: Sound travels much slower on Mars than on Earth, researchers find
node.description: On Earth, a high-pitched sound might travel 213 feet — but it will travel just 26 feet on Mars.

node.title: Blues too good for Moana Pasifika
node.description: The Blues have defeated Moana Pasifika 46-16 in their Super Rugby Pacific match at Eden Park.

node.title: Australia, India sign trade deal in virtual ceremony
node.description: Australia has formally signed a trade deal with India as the two nations signal an intention to forge closer trade ties.

node.title: Three Waters package funds affirmation of local government - LGNZ
node.description: Three Waters Reform Package grants are recognition of funding constraints on local councils, and backing for local authorities, Local Government NZ says.

node.title: Back to back wins for the Warriors
node.description: The Warriors have kept the Brisbane Broncos scoreless in the second half to win their NRL match 20-6 in Redcliffe.

node.title: Sri Lanka declares emergency after violent protests over economic crisis
node.description: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has declared a nation-wide public emergency following violent protests over the country's worst economic crisis in decades.

node.title: Police launch homicide investigation after South Auckland death
node.description: A homicide investigation has been launched following the death of a man in the South Auckland suburb of Favona overnight.

node.title: What Will Smith's resignation from the Academy means for the actor
node.description: Smith announced his resignation from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences on Friday – and many were left wondering what it would mean for the actor's future.
